decks.notes: This deck focuses on using a variety of creature cards to assemble a powerful combination that can generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Ritual, the deck can quickly search for and play key creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Orcish Bowmasters. The toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups, while the combo potential of the creatures provides a strong win condition. Additionally, cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize help control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for consistent damage output. The inclusion of cards like Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provides additional threats, while control elements like Static Prison and Thraben Charm help disrupt opponent strategies. The mana base is designed for consistency and speed, allowing for quick deployment of threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently with a mix of creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play powerful land-based combos, such as Primeval Titan fetching powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck utilizes Amulet of Vigor to untap lands for more ramp, while also using cards like Explore and Arboreal Grazer to accelerate mana production. The goal is to play Primeval Titan to search for key lands like Gruul Turf and Crumbling Vestige, leading to explosive plays like Scapeshift to win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat abilities. By utilizing cards such as Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and deal damage efficiently. Cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment provide additional removal and reach, while Seasoned Pyromancer and Ocelot Pride offer card advantage and extra threats. The deck also includes some disruption with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm to control the opponent's board. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, aggressive plays to pressure the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying aggressive pressure with efficient creatures. By using a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push along with creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, the deck aims to control the board and slow down the opponent's strategy. Cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate provide additional utility and control elements, allowing for versatile plays. The deck utilizes a mix of creatures and spells to aggressively disrupt the opponent's resources and win through a combination of attacking and controlling the game state.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and played using Chord of Calling. It utilizes a combination of creature abilities and sacrifice effects to generate value and create advantageous board states. The deck aims to efficiently find and deploy key creatures like Ruthless Lawbringer and Sephiroth, Fabled SOLDIER, while also maintaining a sacrificial engine with cards like Carrion Feeder and Cauldron Familiar. By leveraging a variety of creature abilities and efficient mana ramping, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a combo-oriented strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of counter spells, removal, and card advantage to control the game. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while slowly building up its own resources. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thundertrap Trainer provide card advantage and filtering, while cards like Flame of Anor and Lightning Bolt handle threats on the board. The deck also includes utility cards like Blood Moon and Subtlety to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, it aims to outlast the opponent and win through incremental advantage and superior decision-making.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through powerful artifact spells and card advantage. By utilizing the UrzaTron lands to assemble mana quickly, the deck aims to cast high-impact spells like Ugin, Tezzeret, and Karn to dominate the battlefield. The deck also includes disruption elements like Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck functions as a reactive control deck that builds up to a game-ending threat while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to quickly overwhelm opponents. It also utilizes Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to enhance its creatures and support spells. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and counter spells like Stubborn Denial to disrupt opponents' game plans. With a diverse land base and cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker for card advantage, this Aggro deck aims to maintain pressure and control the tempo of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana, ramping up to play Primeval Titan and combo-ing off with Amulet of Vigor to tutor for more lands and set up a game-ending Scapeshift. It utilizes the unique lands and bounce lands to generate extra mana and ramp efficiently, while also having options for protection and flexibility with cards like Aftermath Analyst and Cultivator Colossus. The goal is to set up a powerful board state quickly and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and a high number of lands in play.

The Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressively attacking the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Voice of Victory and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining aggression, burn spells, and disruption, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victories.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. It includes powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure early on. The deck also utilizes Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls to buff up its creatures and create a strong board presence. With a mix of burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and versatile cards like Seasoned Pyromancer, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient aggression while also having some control elements with cards like Static Prison.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ketramose, the New Dawn from the graveyard quickly and efficiently. The key strategy is to set up combos where you can cheat these creatures into play without paying their high mana costs, while also disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending. The deck is designed to be able to handle a variety of threats and play styles, making it versatile and adaptable in different matchups.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful combo cards and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent without relying on traditional land cards. By combining cards like Lotus Bloom and Goblin Charbelcher with cards that offer disruption and protection, such as Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation, the deck aims to create a fast and resilient strategy that can take down opponents swiftly. With a mixture of tempo control and aggressive tactics, the deck seeks to outmaneuver and outpace the opponent in order to secure victory.

This deck aims to quickly cycle through cards to fill up the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to board wipe and bring all those creatures back onto the battlefield for a massive advantage. It also includes cards like Generous End and Subtlety to disrupt the opponent's strategy and keep them on the back foot. The inclusion of Force of Negation and other control elements help to protect the combo and ensure its success, while also providing versatility in different matchups. Additionally, the diverse land base offers flexibility and options for different game situations.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a lot of mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, then use that mana to cast a large number of spells in a single turn. This deck aims to chain together multiple spells and combos to create a powerful storm of spells, ultimately overwhelming the opponent and winning the game. It utilizes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve to draw cards and find combo pieces, while also utilizing Past in Flames to flashback spells from the graveyard. It aims to win the game quickly and decisively through efficient combo play.
